chain.description: I am calling the "search_pro_for_streaming_availability" function to search for the streaming availability of motivational podcasts on platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts. By specifying the arguments "country" as "US" and "services" as "Spotify,Apple Podcasts", I can retrieve the relevant information about the availability of these podcasts in the United States on the mentioned platforms. This will help me provide the user with accurate and up-to-date streaming options for their hiking trip.

chain.observation: {"error": "Unsubscribed error...", "response": "{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}"}

chain.description: I am calling the "search_pro_for_streaming_availability" function to search for the streaming availability of motivational podcasts on platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts. Since the previous call returned an error stating that the API is not subscribed, I am modifying the arguments to include the service "Hulu" instead of "Apple Podcasts". This adjustment should help me retrieve the relevant information about the availability of these podcasts on Hulu in the United States. By doing so, I can still provide the user with streaming options for their hiking trip, even if it is not on the exact platforms they initially requested.

chain.observation: {"error": "Unsubscribed error...", "response": "{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}"}

chain.description: ling the "search_pro_for_streaming_availability" function again to search for the streaming availability of motivational podcasts on platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts. Since the previous call returned an error stating that the API is not subscribed, I am modifying the arguments once more. This time, I am including the service "Pandora" instead of "Apple Podcasts" and "Spotify". By doing so, I hope to retrieve the relevant information about the availability of these podcasts on Pandora in the United States. Despite the initial setback, I am determined to find streaming options for the user's hiking trip, even if it is not on the exact platforms they initially requested.

chain.observation: {"error": "Unsubscribed error...", "response": "{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}"}

chain.description:
ize, but I am currently unable to access the streaming availability information for podcasts on platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts. However, I can still recommend some motivational podcasts for your hiking trip. Here are a few suggestions:

1. "The Tim Ferriss Show": Hosted by Tim Ferriss, this podcast features in-depth interviews with world-class performers from various fields.

2. "How I Built This": Hosted by Guy Raz, this podcast explores the stories behind some of the most successful companies and entrepreneurs.

3. "The GaryVee Audio Experience": Hosted by Gary Vaynerchuk, this podcast covers entrepreneurship, marketing, and personal development.

4. "The Art of Scrubs": Hosted by Tiffany A. McFadden and Alexis Owens, this podcast provides insights on personal and professional development through the lens of a medical professional's journey.

5. "HBR IdeaCast": Hosted by Harvard Business Review, this podcast features interviews with leading thinkers in business and management.

As for healthy snacks for your hike, some options to consider are:

1. Nuts and seeds: Almonds, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, or chia seeds.

2. Dried fruits: Raisins, apricots, dates, or dried cranberries.

3. Jerky: Beef jerky, turkey jerky, or chicken jerky.

4. Energy bars: Look for options with natural ingredients and minimal added sugars.

5. Nut butter: Carry individual packets of almond butter, peanut butter, or other nut butter.

Please note that the availability of podcasts may vary depending on your location and internet connection. Enjoy your hiking trip and have a great time listening to these inspiring podcasts!

function.name: titles_with_changed_episodes_for_watchmode
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "watchmode", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get a listing of titles that have changes to their episodes (new episodes, episode details changed, etc) within the date range."

function.name: search_for_watchmode
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "watchmode", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "search_for_watchmode for titles or people using an external ID (IMDB, TheMovieDB.org), or by name. Returns an array of results objects, that can either be a title or a person. Useful for getting the Watchmode IDs for titles and people. For example, you can"

search_field.description:
The field for us to search in, either a 3rd party ID or \\\"name\\\" which will search for a movie/show title or a person's name depending on the type(s) set. Must be one of the following options:
imdb_id, tmdb_person_id, tmdb_movie_id, tmdb_tv_id, name.

search_value.description: The value we should search for. For example, if you set search_field to imdb_id, this would be the IMDB title/person ID, eg. tt0944947.

types.description:
Pass one of the following values, or multiple comma separated values to only return certain types:
tv, movie, person.

function.name: autocomplete_search_for_watchmode
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "watchmode", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Search for titles/and or people by name or a partial name. Useful for building an autocomplete search of titles and/or people. The results include the field result_type to indicate which type of result it is (title or person). For titles, the movie poster "

search_value.description: The phrase to search for, can be a full title or person name, or a partial phrase. For example searching for \"The sha\" will find the movie \"The Shawshank Redemption\".

search_type.description: Set this to 1 to include titles and people in results. Set this to 2 to include titles only. Set this to 3 to include movies only. Set this to 4 to include TV only. Set this to 5 to include people only. By default this is set to 1.

function.name: get_ultra_for_streaming_availability
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "streaming_availability", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get the details of a show via IMDb or TMDb id, including the global streaming availability info"

function.name: search_pro_for_streaming_availability
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "streaming_availability", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 10. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link "

country.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

services.description:
A comma separated list of up to 8 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of t

year_max.description: Maximum release/air year of the show.

cursor.description: Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with

desc.description:
Use descending order?

Possible values are `true` and `false`. Default value is `false`.

genres_relation.description:
When more than one genre is supplied in `genres` parameter, `genres_relation` chooses the matching style against

When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres.
When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the

year_min.description: Minimum release/air year of the show.

show_original_language.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

genres.description:
Comma separated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genres. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

When more than one genre supplied, set `genres_relation` parameter to specify between returning shows that have a

show_type.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

order_by.description:
Determines the ordering of the results.

Possible values are `original_title` and `year`. Default value is `original_title`

output_language.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

keyword.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

function.name: search_ultra_for_streaming_availability

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of

function.name: basic_info_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get info on a  cast such as name , profession , birth and death year , bio , poster , best titles  etc."

function.name: ott_providers_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get  information on OTT platforms we suuport ."

region.description: currently only USA and India region is supported enter param 'US' for USA and 'IN' for India.

function.name: title_details_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get basic information on a movie or tv show such as imdbid , title , genre , runtime , imdbrating , language , synopsis , type , imageurl  , Streaming platforms info etc."

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.watchmode: Universal OTT Streaming Service Availability API (Netflix, HBO Max, Peacock, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, AppleTV+, Disney+ & over 100 more)
2.streaming_availability: Netflix, Prime, Disney, HBO, Hulu and many others. Lookup which shows are available on streaming services across 60 countries
3.ott_details: Get Streaming details of Movie and TV Shows. We support 150+ Streaming platforms in US and India such as HBO, YouTube, Netflix , Primve Video, Hotstar, Hulu, etc . (use our OTT Providers endpoint to get the full list OTT providers we support) . In additon to streaming info we also provide basic details on any given movie title.

2. "How I Built This": Hosted by Guy Raz, this podcast explores the stories behind some of the most successful companies and entrepreneurs.

3. "The GaryVee Audio Experience": Hosted by Gary Vaynerchuk, this podcast covers entrepreneurship, marketing, and personal development.

4. "The Art of Scrubs": Hosted by Tiffany A. McFadden and Alexis Owens, this podcast provides insights on personal and professional development through the lens of a medical professional's journey.

5. "HBR IdeaCast": Hosted by Harvard Business Review, this podcast features interviews with leading thinkers in business and management.

As for healthy snacks for your hike, some options to consider are:

1. Nuts and seeds: Almonds, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, or chia seeds.

2. Dried fruits: Raisins, apricots, dates, or dried cranberries.

3. Jerky: Beef jerky, turkey jerky, or chicken jerky.

4. Energy bars: Look for options with natural ingredients and minimal added sugars.

5. Nut butter: Carry individual packets of almond butter, peanut butter, or other nut butter.

Please note that the availability of podcasts may vary depending on your location and internet connection. Enjoy your hiking trip and have a great time listening to these inspiring podcasts!

function_call.name: Finish

answer_generation.query: I'm planning a hiking trip with my friends and we want to listen to some inspiring podcasts during the journey. Can you recommend some motivational podcasts and provide the streaming availability on platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts? Also, suggest some healthy snacks for the hike.
